Package com.datastructures

Class MainPortal

java.lang.Object
com.datastructures.MainPortal
Direct Known Subclasses:
ParentScreen, StudentScreen, TeacherScreen
public class MainPortal
extends java.lang.Object
This class is the entry point into the app. It lets the user login then takes them to the corresponding screen. Each type of user will have a specific type of screen available to them.
Author:
Biruk Mengistu, Mya Hartman, Elena Lam

    • requestData

      public static java.lang.String requestData​(java.lang.String type, int... numOfChoices)
      This is an important method. It will be handling all the inputs that we will be receiving from the user.

      The input can be of type: 1. Password: A password to login or sign up with 2. Username: A username to login or sign up with. 3. Type: Whether or not the user is a student, parent or teacher. 4. Choice: A list of numbers that the user can choose from.

      Note: This method will be used in all of the screens as well since they extend this class.

      Parameters:
      type - : the type of input that will be requested.
      numOfChoices - : If type is "choice", then the second optional argument will be the number of choices for the user to select from.
      Returns:
      the appropriate input entered by the user.

    • signIn

      private static User signIn()
      Lets the user sign in.
      Returns:
      the signed in user

    • print

      public static void print​(java.lang.Object string, java.lang.Object... toBeAdded)
      This is a helpful method that will help format text that will be outputted onto the screen. It serves three purposes:

      1. Prints out a line separator by simply typing three spaces. 2. prints a newline escape character/ "\n" by typing two spaces 3. Puts in strings in place of "_". This makes it easier to concatenate or join many strings together.

      Parameters:
      string - : the string to which we will be inserting strings into, also the string to be finally printed.
      toBeAdded - : the strings that will be inserted into @param string
